availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Pleasant Banister and Mary Banister. Married to Margret Banister. Father of Anna L. Banister. Resident in Johnson County in 1850 and 1860. Served in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia as second lieutenant from May 21, 1864 to June 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 124B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 15.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Paintsville, p. 4.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 896.
